name: Smash Burgers and Burger Sauce
description: Quick, flavorful smash burgers best served with homemade burger sauce. Juicy patties with minimal toppings for maximum beefy goodness.
gist: Smash balls of ground beef on a very hot cast iron pan, toast buns, add cheese and burger sauce, and assemble quickly.
ingredients:
~6 oz lean ground beef per person
Buns of choice
Optional cheese slices
Butter
Salt and pepper
steps:
1. Form ground beef into 3 oz balls (about tangerine size).
2. Butter buns and toast in a pan. Prepare all buns first as burgers cook fast (~90 seconds each).
3. Heat a cast iron pan until smoking. Add beef balls (cook in pairs for doubles).
4. Smash patties as flat as possible.
5. Season with salt and pepper (and optional MSG).
6. When liquid rises and underside smells nearly burnt, scrape and flip (~1 minute).
7. Season the next side and add cheese.
8. Cook 2nd side 30â€“60 seconds until cheese is melted.
9. Prepare buns with burger sauce.
10. Remove patties and assemble the burgers.
11. Keep toppings simple: burger sauce and optional cheese. Additional toppings should be minimal to highlight the meat and sauce.
notes: Pair with homemade burger sauce for best results.
